info.title: Talk Proposals API
info.description: API documentation for the Talk Proposals system. This API allows speakers to submit talk proposals, reviewers to review them, and admins to manage the proposal status.

get.description: Retrieves all proposals with filtering options. Only accessible by admin users. Includes additional filters like user_id.

patch.description: Updates the status of a proposal. Only accessible by admin users. Triggers real-time broadcast event.

post.description: Creates a new user account with the provided information. The user will be automatically logged in after registration.
Authenticates a user with email and password. Uses Laravel Sanctum for SPA authentication with session cookies.

get.description: Returns the currently authenticated user's information.

post.description: Logs out the currently authenticated user and invalidates the session.

get.summary: List all proposals for review (Reviewer only)
get.description: Retrieves all proposals for reviewers to review. Only accessible by reviewer users. Supports full-text search (using Laravel Scout with Algolia) across title, description, tags, and author name. Also supports filtering by tags and status.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Full-text search across proposal title, description, tags, and author name. Uses Laravel Scout with Algolia for advanced search capabilities when configured.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by tag IDs (comma-separated or array)

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of proposals. Speakers see only their own proposals, while reviewers and admins see all proposals. Supports full-text search (using Laravel Scout with Algolia) across title, description, tags, and author name. Also supports filtering by tags and status.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filter by tag IDs (comma-separated or array)

post.description: Creates a new talk proposal. File upload is optional (PDF, max 4MB). Tags can be provided as an array of strings (will be created if they don't exist). Status defaults to 'pending'.

description.example: A comprehensive guide to Laravel framework

get.description: Retrieves a single proposal by ID. Speakers can only view their own proposals, while reviewers and admins can view any proposal.

put.description: Updates an existing proposal. Speakers can only update their own proposals. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

tags.description: Array of tag names (optional, empty array removes all tags)

delete.description: Deletes a proposal and its associated file. Speakers can only delete their own proposals.

get.description: Retrieves approved proposals with an average rating of 4.0 or higher, ordered by rating and review count. Used for displaying featured proposals in a slider.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of proposals to return

get.description: Downloads the PDF file associated with a proposal. Requires authentication and appropriate permissions.
Returns all available rating options (1-5 and 10) with their labels.
Retrieves all reviews for a specific proposal, ordered by most recent first.

post.description: Creates a new review for a proposal. Each reviewer can only review a proposal once. Rating must be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 10.

get.description: Retrieves a single review by ID for a specific proposal.

put.description: Updates an existing review. Only admins can update reviews. Rating must be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 10.

get.description: Retrieves all available tags. Supports optional search by name.

post.description: Creates a new tag or returns the existing tag if a tag with the same name already exists.

description.example: A comprehensive guide to Laravel framework

sanctum.description: Laravel Sanctum SPA authentication using session cookies. To authenticate: 1) Log in via the frontend application at http://talkproposals.test/login, 2) The session cookie will be automatically sent with requests from the same browser. Note: Swagger UI cannot manually set session cookies - you must authenticate via the frontend first.
sanctum.name: laravel_session
